snippet.title: 2021 Panel Discussion: Best Practices to Deliver Restorative Justice in Cases of SA/SV
snippet.description:
Listen in on our latest panel discussion hosted by Lanark County Community Justice thanks to the Department of Justice Canada in honour of Victims and Survivors of Crime Week 2021. 

If you are unfamiliar with Restorative Justice, we highly recommend that you view this video prior to watching the Panel Discussion, to gain a better understanding of the restorative justice process. "What is Restorative Justice?" by the Correctional Service of Canada: https://youtu.be/4VPStZAamxg

The Panel Discussion: 
Join our panelists as they explore and discuss a collaborative, measured, safe and specialized restorative justice response to sexualized harm, with appropriately trained volunteers and paid facilitators, on a local and national level.
This panel discussion will explore the success and challenges, supports and services, training, screening tools and best practices that need to be in place to deliver restorative justice in cases of sexualized violence to deliver the best outcomes. A restorative justice response to sexualized harm continues to be a controversial proposition amongst many justice partners and victim service providers. Accordingly, we hope to engage the community in collaboratively contributing to the dialogue to better understand how we can best serve victims of sexualized violence with restorative justice services.

The Panelists: 
Host - Joellen McHard of Lanark County Community Justice 
ALLAN EDWARDS, Correction Service Canada
SHERI HALLADAY, Lanark County Community Justice
MARK MACDONALD, Criminal Lawyer
AMBER MONTGOMERY, Senior Caseworker, Collaborative Justice Program - Ottawa
MAUREEN MCLEOD FRAZER, Coordinator, Sexual Assault & Domestic Violence Program, Perth & Smiths Falls District Hospital

Music from bensound.com
